FAIRFAX , Iowa  Will Forester spends his days fixing boats .
Every 10 to 20 minutes , he hears the horn of a Union Pacific train as it approaches Forester Marine in downtown Fairfax .
The freight trains hauling coal hoppers , tank cars and flatbeds roar by his boat - repair shop , shaking the century - old former depot and making Forester 's ears ring .

The Bakken formation , which covers about 200,000 square miles in North Dakota , Montana and Canada , has been known to be a vast oil source since the 1950s .
Bakken crude has more flammable gasses and is more likely to explode , the federal government has warned .
